page.title: 16INGSDON MANOR HOUSE (RUIN)
page.content: {Ingsdon}was mentioned in the 1086 {Domesday Book}as{AINECHESDONA}and has been continuously occupied since 1200. It has seen four fires during its history,the last one in 1977 destroying the building there. The site has been continuously occupied since 1200 and has been variously used for a chancel chapel,a manor,a convent a Catholic Girls' school and a school for maladjusted boys. As a girls school before 1971 it was run on stictly religious lines.All but 2 teachers were nuns .Boarders had to attend regular services in the chapel, and all children were taught the Catholic prayers and religion. The uniform was a navy blue skirt,navy cardigan,white blouse and a dark blue hat with a badge.In summer,striped or checked dresses and straw hats were worn.
